intro: Aporosa lindleyana, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a tropical shrub belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are followed by orange to red berries containing smooth, dark seeds. It is native to Central and South America and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural purposes.
